rundown: 9-12 L vs New York Yankees Joey Wentz: 4.0 innings, 0 earned runs, 2 hits, 0 HR, 2 strikeouts Batters: Ozzie Albies (2 hits - 4 AB, 1 HR, 5 RBI) Michael Harris II (1 hit - 4 AB, 1 HR, 2 RBI) Nick Allen (1 hit - 4 AB, 0 HR, 1 RBI) The Braves fell to the New York Yankees in a high-scoring affair, unable to hold off a late surge from their opponents. Despite a strong start from Joey Wentz, who pitched 4 scoreless innings, the bullpen struggled to maintain the lead. Key highlights include: 1. Ozzie Albies had a standout performance, hitting a home run and driving in five runs. 2. Michael Harris II also contributed with a home run and two RBIs. 3. The Braves managed to score nine runs but could not outpace the Yankees' twelve runs, highlighting a lack of pitching depth in the later innings.
